com.terei.jvector.gui
Class StatusBarManager

java.lang.Object
  com.terei.jvector.gui.StatusBarManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
MouseListener, EventListener
public class StatusBarManager
extends Object
implements MouseListener

A reusable class that provides functions to easily implement a status bar on an appliaction that displays tool tips. See Builder.com - Improving your Java GUI with status-bar hints for more information.

Author:
Alexandre Pereira Calsavara

          A reference to the JLabel that is used to display the hints.

          A map (searchable) which holds all the various 'hints' for the various componenets.

Constructor Detail

StatusBarManager

public StatusBarManager(JLabel hintLabel)

Parameters:
hintLabel - Specifies the JLabel in which the hints should appear.
Method Detail

addHintFor

public void addHintFor(Component comp,
                       String hintText)
Adds a 'hint'/tooltip for the componenet specified.

Parameters:
comp - The component that the hint is for, when the mouse is over this component the hint will appear.
hintText - The hint to display.

enableHints

public void enableHints(Component comp)
The component to enable the 'hints'/tooltips for. This enable's the component and its children to display hints in the status bar. This method should be called intitially once the GUI is setup, before it is deiplayed, and also, when new Components are added, although in this case, this method should be called on just the new component.

Parameters:
comp - The component to register this class with to displays hints.

getHintFor

private String getHintFor(Component comp)
Gets the hint for the component. If no hint has been specified, then it checks to see if it is a JLabel, or JTabbedHeader and if so, returns their text.

Parameters:
comp - The component to which this hint is associated.
Returns:
The hint.
